abstract_summ: Conclusions and Relevance Patients with COVID-19 commonly have neurologic manifestations.Among them, 12 patients were still quarantined in the hospital, 5 patients were discharged NCP patients according to the national standards.Moreover, discharged NCP patients had higher heart rate, lymphocytes levels and monocytes levels than non-discharged NCP patients on admission to the hospital.Compared with non-ICU patients, ICU patients had higher plasma levels of IL2, IL7, IL10, GSCF, IP10, MCP1, MIP1A, and TNFα.Chest computed tomographic scans showed bilateral patchy shadows or ground glass opacity in the lungs of all patients.
title_summ: Clinical Characteristics of 138 Hospitalized Patients With 2019 Novel Coronavirus-Infected Pneumonia in Wuhan, China.[Clinical features of 2019 novel coronavirus pneumonia in the early stage from a fever clinic in Beijing].[Clinical features of 2019 novel coronavirus pneumonia in the early stage from a fever clinic in Beijing].Clinical Characteristics of 34 Children with Coronavirus Disease-2019 in the West of China: a Multiple-center Case SeriesEpidemiological and Clinical Characteristics of 17 Hospitalized Patients with 2019 Novel Coronavirus Infections Outside Wuhan, ChinaClinical features of patients infected with 2019 novel coronavirus in Wuhan, ChinaClinical and epidemiological characteristics of pediatric SARS-CoV-2 infections in China: A multicenter case seriesNeurologic Manifestations of Hospitalized Patients With Coronavirus Disease 2019 in Wuhan, China.Ocular Manifestations of Hospitalized Patients with COVID-19 in Northeast of Iran.
title_abstract_phrases: Conclusions and Relevance Patients with COVID-19 commonly have neurologic manifestations.Among them, 12 patients were still quarantined in the hospital, 5 patients were discharged NCP patients according to the national standards.Moreover, discharged NCP patients had higher heart rate, lymphocytes levels and monocytes levels than non-discharged NCP patients on admission to the hospital.Compared with non-ICU patients, ICU patients had higher plasma levels of IL2, IL7, IL10, GSCF, IP10, MCP1, MIP1A, and TNFα.Presumed hospital-related transmission was suspected if a cluster of health professionals or hospitalized patients in the same wards became infected and a possible source of infection could be tracked.
